Gojek Akui Sudah Jajaki Kerja Sama dalam To Laut
07 Nov 2019, 01:27 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Perhubungan menyatakan akan menggandeng Gojek Indonesia dan startup lainnya dalan program Tol Laut untuk menghilangkan praktik monopoli. Manajemen Gojek pun mengakui sedang menjajaki kerja sama dalam program angkutan laut bersubsidi itu dan masih mempelajari skema pelaksanaan Tol Laut.
"Saat ini, kami masih mempelajari hal tersebut dan akan berkoordinasi dengan pemerintah untuk melaksanakan langkah selanjutnya,” kata SVP Public Policy and Government Relations Gojek Indonesia, Panji Ruky saat dihubungi Bisnis.com, Rabu 6 November 2019.
Panji menyambut baik dan mendukung upaya pemerintah dalam melibatkan pihak swasta, khususnya perusahaan teknologi untuk meningkatkan efisiensi layanan logistik antarpulau tersebut. Menurut dia, dilibatkannya Gojek di program pemerintah sesuai dengan visi perusahaan untuk menghilangkan kendala dalam kehidupan sehari-hari sesuai tagar yang digaungkannya, yakni #PastiAdaJalan.
“Kami menyambut baik serta mendukung upaya pemerintah mengajak pihak swasta khususnya perusahaan teknologi, untuk meningkatkan kualitas dan efisiensi layanan transportasi dan logistik antarpulau di Indonesia," kata Panji.
Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi beberapa waktu lalu mencurigai ada monopoli harga Tol Laut. Sebagai salah satu solusi dalam menghentikan praktik monopoli program Tol Laut tersebut, Kemenhub bersama dengan seluruh pemangku kepentingan dan shipper/consignee melaksanakan evaluasi kuota muatan dan pengawasan disparitas harga barang.
Ditjen Perhubungan Laut Kementerian Perhubungan pun menyatakan bakal menggandeng perusahaan layanan online PT Aplikasi Karya Anak Bangsa dalam Tol Laut. Perusahaan Gojek ini dilibatkan untuk digitalisasi pelayanan dengan menggunakan aplikasi berbasis digital (e-commerce) guna meningkatkan layanan Tol Laut.
Pelibatan startup dimaksudkan untuk memudahkan proses pemesanan kontainer secara transparan. Selain itu juga agar dapat membagi muatan secara fair kepada shipper yang ada di daerah Terpencil, Tertinggal, Terluar dan Perbatasan (3TP).
Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Ditjen Perhubungan Laut Kemenhub Wisnu Handoko menuturkan, platform digital ini diharapkan memberikan peluang yang lebih mudah. "Karena masyarakat Indonesia yang sudah mulai terbiasa menggunakan aplikasi seperti Gojek untuk berbagai pemesanan transportasi," ujarnya.

Gojek Akui Already Explores Cooperation in the Sea
Nov 7 2019, 01:27 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ministry of Transportation said it would partner with Gojek Indonesia and other startups in the Sea Toll program to eliminate monopolistic practices. Gojek's management also admitted that they are exploring cooperation in the subsidized sea transportation program and are still studying the scheme of implementing the Sea Toll.
"At the moment, we are still studying this matter and will coordinate with the government to carry out the next step," said Gojek Indonesia's SVP Public Policy and Government Relations, Panji Ruky when contacted by Bisnis.com, Wednesday 6 November 2019.
Panji welcomed and supported the government's efforts to involve the private sector, especially technology companies, to improve the efficiency of inter-island logistics services. According to him, the involvement of Gojek in the government program is in accordance with the company's vision to eliminate obstacles in daily life according to the hashtag that he echoed, namely #PastiAdaJalan.
"We welcome and support the government's efforts to invite private parties, especially technology companies, to improve the quality and efficiency of inter-island transportation and logistics services in Indonesia," Panji said.
President Joko Widodo or Jokowi some time ago suspected there was a monopoly on the price of the Sea Toll Road. As one of the solutions in stopping the monopolistic practice of the Sea Toll program, the Ministry of Transportation together with all stakeholders and shipper / consignee conducted an evaluation of the quota of the cargo and the supervision of the disparity in the price of goods.
The Directorate General of Sea Transportation of the Ministry of Transportation also said that it would partner with an online service company, PT Aplikasi Karya Anak Bangsa in Sea Toll. The Gojek company is involved in digitizing services by using digital-based applications (e-commerce) to improve Sea Toll services.
Startup engagement is intended to facilitate the process of ordering containers transparently. In addition, in order to be able to distribute the cargo fairly to shipper in Remote, Disadvantaged, Outermost and Border areas (3TP).
Director of Traffic and Sea Transportation at the Directorate General of Sea Transportation at the Ministry of Transportation Wisnu Handoko said that this digital platform is expected to provide easier opportunities. "Because Indonesian people are getting used to using applications such as Gojek for various transportation bookings," he said.
